P1 (SB): 980.00 chips | bet 20.00 | active
Your hole: A♠, A♣
==============================================
rounds.response:
A♠ A♣ is the best possible starting hand in Hold’Em. I’m out of position (big blind) but have Position post-flop because the small blind posts. Facing a 10-chip raise to 20 total, 3-betting for value is mandatory.

I’ll make a standard 3-bet sizing: about 3× the open, so 3 × 20 = 60 chips.

[Raise 40]

rounds.response:
We currently have the best starting hand in hold’em, pocket Aces. On this dry-ish flop (8♥ K♦ 7♦) our over-pair is still almost certainly ahead of villain’s range. We want to build the pot now rather than risk giving free cards, and a value-heavy, standard ~70 % pot-sized bet will accomplish that.

Pot is 120, so I’ll fire 80–90 chips. 85 is a clean-looking amount that keeps Villain’s continue range wide while growing the pot.

[Bet 85]
